citation.article-title: Reclassification of marine Agrobacterium species: Proposals of Stappia stellulata gen. nov., comb. nov., Stappia aggregata sp. nov., nom. rev., Ruegeria atlantica gen. nov., comb. nov., Ruegeria gelatinovora comb. nov., Ruegeria algicola comb. nov., and Ahrensia kieliense gen. nov., sp. nov., nom. rev.
citation.source: The Journal of General and Applied Microbiology

p.s: Description of Ahrensia kieliense (ex Ahrens 1968) sp. nov., nom. rev.
Ahrensia kieliense (kiel.i.ense. M.L. fem. n. Kiel, pertaining to Kiel, the source of the soil from which the organism was isolated)
The following description is based on our own observations and previous descriptions of the species by Rüger and Höfle (1992).
Nitrate is not reduced to nitrite or gas.
Acids are produced from fructose and xylose after 4 to 6 weeks of incubation.
None of 34 organic substrates is utilized at 20°C.
Isolated from seawater of the Baltic Sea.
The G+C content of the DNA is 48 mol%.
